Interesting debate about why Chinese mainland is not included in the UK's "#airbridge" list for #quarantine-free travel while countries with more infections are. One cannot stop pondering whether that has anything to do with the US not being on the list.  https://t.co/pAOx7k7tw0 https://t.co/vO2ydLElRi

Despite the unexpected challenges posed by the #COVID19, it looks like many Chinese students remain keen to embark on their studies in the UK this September. https://t.co/auzP2SzBER https://t.co/xU5JGgp4lX

legacy.full_text: An Irish woman who spent 79 days on a ventilator has recovered from #COVID19 thanks to advice from Chinese medical practitioners. #China #Ireland https://t.co/odPwmquM2V

#FightTogether Another prime example of successful Sino-Irish cooperation -- the experience and knowledge shared by Chinese medical practitioners on treating #COVID19 patients has saved many lives in Ireland. https://t.co/r6u8XuH0XI @ChinaEmbIreland @IrlEmbChina @elaineahealy

A teenage from N England, who is being homeschooled during #COVID19 lockdown, decided to raise money for less-fortunate youngsters, by walking 5 miles from home to school, carrying an increasingly large number of books each day til Jul 17. https://t.co/irrUdBWKfq @NP_Partnership https://t.co/RRBMhjNVfk

A growing number of people in the #UK have reported symptoms more compatible with #COVID19 than with seasonable flu from late Dec and Jan, prompting questions about when the novel coronavirus arrived in the country. And this has even swayed some experts. https://t.co/6dQ3udnnLS https://t.co/TtDi0CXysw

The 2-week quarantine rule in the UK, which has too many arbitrary exemptions and very little enforcement, personally I think it is a meaningless and non-scientific instrument, which relies on too much on people doing the right thing and behaving sensibly. https://t.co/8lIgOdug2q https://t.co/a2E4q6B3gz

"Blame China" rhetoric and longstanding "yellow peril" scare tactics are creating hostility toward Chinese people, and the first three months of 2020 saw a record number of nearly 300 offenses of racial hate crimes against British Chinese communities.  https://t.co/3XYC5pAghR https://t.co/ZyBUcJPqEh

Research shows men in the UK have been more mobile than women, before & during the lockdown, raising questions about whether that may have contributed to the increased incidence of hospitalization and higher mortality rates among men during the pandemic. https://t.co/BstqwXJatz https://t.co/GaC36QdqcA

legacy.full_text:
Ian Jones, a professor of virology at University of Reading, has spoken to China Daily about the origin of the novel #coronavirus. 
He said the virus will arise somewhere and the notion of blaming a country for this “is a mistake”. https://t.co/SY7dl2QeIk

A British virologist says the exact precursor of the pandemic may only be found as "a matter of chance", because that transmission from the animal virus to the intermediate animal and then to human "could have been a very transient event". 
@UniofReading https://t.co/8SeQ2GaXfW

Advanced respirator upgraded by scientists and engineers at @imperialcollege has proved particularly useful for medics during throat surgeries, such as tracheostomies, where they are at greater risk of catching the virus due to the nature of the operation. https://t.co/U6VZS8Wsk0 https://t.co/HPcQVnti07

legacy.full_text: It was a delight to talk to Paul O’Brien, a China-based regulatory expert, who helped Ireland to end up situations such as sending off COVID-19 tests to Germany due to shortage of testing kits. Coincidentally, as an Irishman, he lives and works in my hometown.  @elaineahealy

When most European nations were competing with each other for supplies in the fight against the #Covid_19 pandemic, an Irishman put his China connections to work and enabled his country to roll out rapid testing for the virus. https://t.co/hFijtsgfsM @IDAIreland_UK @elaineahealy

In face of an unprecedented global crisis, how do you think the government should strike the balance between civil liberties and the need to protect the public from #COVID19? #NHSApp  https://t.co/KsWJUkCrBk https://t.co/PpflLFoR3W

legacy.full_text: The British beer and pub sector has survived two world wars and a financial crisis, but the true test is if it survives the #COVID19 lockdown. #UK https://t.co/7rvuv5tWmX

British pubs have survived two world wars, and a global economic downturn, but whether the business can survive COVID-19, that is a "real test", says the trade body leader, as pubs are likely to remain closed for far longer than most other businesses. https://t.co/vBbJoOGzYn

legacy.full_text: Professor Franklin Allen at Imperial College London said the #UK was somewhat slow in putting in place lockdown measures and the government did not pay much attention to lessons from Asia in terms of how it dealt with the #pandemic. #COVID19 https://t.co/iWqqrmyz21

Franklin Allen, a prof of economics said, "One of the problems is that we focus a lot on other European countries are doing, we do not focus nearly enough on China, South Korea, Singapore and HK and other places in Asia are doing." https://t.co/Em2OFKWzyD @imperialcollege

In this challenging time, we should really refrain from politicizing the virus and pointing fingers. The virus respects no borders and it is a common enemy of the whole of humanity.  Let's please work together to beat this pandemic! https://t.co/Q7QfpRB9aK @ChineseEmbinUK https://t.co/6iaIcBYP4o
